q: country's historical sites. "Egyptian cultural heritage, both its monuments and its artefacts, are part of the ancestral heritage of humanity, handed down to us through the ages," she said. The value of the 120,000 pieces in the Egyptian Museum in Cairo is inestimable, not only in scientific or financial terms, but because they represent the Egyptian people's cultural identity. Playing down the damage But the country's newly appointed minister of antiquities, well-known egyptologist Zahi Hawass , on Thursday played down accounts of the break-in at the Museum and warned against "rumours."

Mike Pence , considered by some a possible GOP Presidential candidate in 2012, has ruled out a run for the White House. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence said in a letter to supporters first reported Thursday by the Indianapolis Star. "We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012." The Washington Post>>>

, "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!" Mr Eric Schmidt has been Google's chief executive since July 2001, when he took over the role from Mr Page. Mr Page said Eric Schmidt had done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. of Evansville political science professor. If Mike Pence is to encounter any bumps at all, they could come early, as he shifts his focus from federal to state issues, Robert Dion said. of one sun god, Aton. The bust is at the top of a "wish list" of five major artifacts exhibited abroad that Egypt wants returned as part of its cultural heritage. Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. with Gabrielle Giffords ' husband, astronaut Mark Kelly, on Saturday night. He described the latest progress in his critically injured wife's recovery. "She's making progress every day," Kirsten Gillibrand said. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. So... it's an extraordinary amount of progress for a woman who sustained such a horrific injury that she did. The University of Arizona said in a news release Sunday that Gabrielle Giffords ' condition had been upgraded from critical to serious because she is no longer on a ventilator.
